rr_event.title: Victoria (Westminster)
rr_event.location: VICTORIA
rr_event.description: Victoria Station Upgrade works Various road restrictions in the Victoria area as part of the continuing Victoria Station Upgrade works and the Victoria Circle development. Wilton Road is closed to all traffic except buses and taxis, diversions are in place. Allington Street is also closed. Delays are possible in the Victoria area, especially at peak times.
rr_event.remark: Due to long term works associated with the Victoria Station Upgrade and Victoria Circle Development projects, there are various restrictions in place around the Victoria one-way system: Bressenden Place is reduced to two lanes; there is no access to Allington Street from Victoria Street; and access to Wilton Road north of Neathouse Place is restricted to buses, taxis and cycles. Buckingham Palace Road also has a lane restriction in place between Bressenden Place and Victoria Street. In addition, Victoria Street is now reduced to one lane as you exit the one-way system heading towards Parliament Square; and, due to emergency works, Buckingham Palace Road is restricted to one lane northbound at Eccleston Bridge. Traffic is flowing normally for the time of day.

rr_event.description: All Directions Traffic signal upgrade works. The work will be carried out in 2 phases as follows: Phase 1 Monday 24 September to Friday 28 September: During the working hours Lea Bridge Road will be reduced to one lane in each direction. Leyton Green Road will be reduced to one lane with the North Bound carriageway closed. Three-way temporary traffic signals will be in operation to control the traffic flow. Phase 2 Monday 01 October to Friday 12 October (week days only): Phase 2 will involve the installation of the new traffic signals, during the working times the offside lanes in both directions on Lea Bridge will be closed using cones and barriers to protect the working area. Daily activity between 09:30 and 15:30.
